[Chouinard] Danilo Gallinari was asked who would be Bucks' leader if Giannis can't go tonight: "I think that if you ask my daughter this question - and she is 7 months (old) - she is going to give you the right answer: Jrue Holiday and Khris Middleton."

[Hollinger] Chicago’s Lauri Markkanen will be an interesting “second wave” free agent after teams miss out on their primary targets...Minnesota is surely one possibility for Markkanen, and for any other ambulatory power forward...Another possible name for the Wolves: Danilo Gallinari.

[The Athletic] The Timberwolves have been making calls all over the league, primarily in pursuit of a power forward, sources tell The Athletic. A trade for Ben Simmons remains highly unlikely for the Wolves. Larry Nance Jr., Danilo Gallinari, and Kyle Kuzma remain options.
Happy 33rd birthday to Danilo Gallinari, who has earned $155M in NBA salaries (50th all-time) and has another $42M in contract money over the upcoming two seasons.

[Moore] The Minnesota Timberwolves have been pursuing Danilo Gallinari from the Atlanta Hawks in the offseason trade market, sources say. Gallinari has two years and $42 million remaining on his contract. The second year (2022-23) is partially guaranteed for $5 million.

[Dane Moore] "The Minnesota Timberwolves have been pursuing Danilo Gallinari from the Atlanta Hawks in the offseason trade market, sources say. Gallinari has two years and $42 million remaining on his contract. The second year (2022-23) is partially guaranteed for $5 million,"
Danilo Gallinari 18 pts 2 threes 2 asts vs Germany 2021 Olympics

[Dane Moore] “The Minnesota Timberwolves have been pursuing Danilo Gallinari from the Atlanta Hawks in the offseason trade market, sources say. Gallinari has two years and $42 million remaining on his contract. The second year (2022-23) is partially guaranteed for $5 million.”

[Moore] The Timberwolves pursuit of Danilo Gallinari was largely tied to a now-defunct concept that included Ricky Rubio in the trade package, sources say. While the Wolves are still canvassing for a power forward, a Gallinari trade would likely require a 3rd team to intrigue Atlanta.

[Danilo Gallinari] I livеd firsthand what happened with the pandеmic situation in Italy… Doctors not being able to manage the situation because the people that were dуing wеre too many. They had to make a decision, who is going to livе and who is not… It was a no-brainеr for me to get the vaссinе.
